sentences.english: The teacher's question caught him flat-footed.
sentences.chinese: 老師的訊問使他倉皇失措。

sentences.english: The suspected offenders involved in a same case shall be interrogated separately.
sentences.chinese: 訊問同案的違法嫌疑人，應當個別進行。

sentences.english: We shall have to detain him and question him.
sentences.chinese: 我們只好把他扣起來，訊問他一下。

sentences.english: Check IDs and question people you don't know.
sentences.chinese: 檢查標識並訊問您不認識的人。

sentences.english: I think examination of witnesses has not begun.
sentences.chinese: 在我來看連對證人的訊問也沒有開始。

sentences.english: Those punks couldn’t bear the interrogation; a tad bitter taste of it just brought them all to confession.
sentences.chinese: 那些渾小子經不起訊問，吃了點苦頭全都說了。

sentences.english: Substantive hearing or trial, where an inquisitorial method is adopted rather than an adversarial method.
sentences.chinese: 實質聽證或審訊，一般採用訊問方式而作對抗形式。

sentences.english: The lawyer took two hours to interrogate the witness.
sentences.chinese: 律師費兩個小時的時間訊問證人。

sentences.english: The judges may interrogate the defendant.
sentences.chinese: 審判人員可以訊問被告人。
警察更進一步地訊問了他。

sentences.english: The record of inquires is the official litigation document made by investigators.
sentences.chinese: 訊問筆錄是由偵查人員製作的法定訴訟文書。

sentences.english: Each group was then asked if they could remember how many times the ball had been passed.
sentences.chinese: 之後，訊問兩組受測者是否還記得傳球滴次數。

sentences.english: Ian was in a cold sweat when the policeman questioned him.
sentences.chinese: 伊恩被警察訊問時嚇出了一身冷汗。

sentences.english: Norwegian police are questioning Brevik second yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 挪威警方也在昨日第二次訊問佈雷維克。

sentences.english: I remember her examination on the selections in the camp.
sentences.chinese: 我記得她在集中營挑選人的方面的訊問。

sentences.english: The old lady inquired of a bystander the reason for the delay in the Queen's arrival .
sentences.chinese: 這位老太大向旁觀者訊問女皇推遲來臨的原因。

definition: to bring to justice/to punish according to the law
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to bring to justice/to hand over to the law
to make a formal request/formal request/to make a claim (law)
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
